alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Meriwether (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 5:17AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fayette, Meriwether, Coweta and southwestern Clayton Counties through 545 AM EST... At 517 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Dunaway Gardens to Luthersville to near Stovall, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Fayetteville, Greenville, Peachtree City, Tyrone, Senoia, Grantville, Woodbury, Luthersville, Whitesburg, Brooks, Moreland, Sharpsburg, Turin, Haralson, Woolsey, Lone Oak, Gay, East Newnan and Starrs Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST for north central and west central Georgia.
